head.supplied: Chief Secretary's Office. ¶ Melbourne 23 February 1877 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ In reply to your inquiry of the 17th instant ¶ whether the Chief Secretary would allow the sum of £900 voted for "Extension and other...

div.p: No. 620, p. 780, unit 44, VPRS 1187/P, outward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office of Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
In reply to your inquiry of the 17th instant
See M to J. MacPherson, 17 February 1877. whether the Chief Secretary would allow the sum of £900 voted for "Extension and other works, Botanical Museum" to be expended on a new building on new ground, I am directed to state that Mr MacPherson has already decided that the Vote is to be used in making additions to the present building.
Note in margin: 'Div. 57 subd. 11 No. 10'. See Victoria, Estimates of expenditure for the year ending 30th June 1877 (Parliamentary Paper B1), p. 47.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,
